oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Soldiers waiting to be picked up by helicopters
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. Users are solely responsible for determining the existence of such instances and for obtaining any other permissions and paying associated fees that may be necessary for the intended use.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Soldiers from the 1st Infantry Division waiting to be picked up by Bell UH-1 "Huey" helicopters. Four helicopters are shown in the process of landing.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Military personnel; Soldiers; Military uniforms; Arms & armament; Helmets; Military vehicles; Aircraft; Helicopters
United States. Army. Infantry Division, 1st; Vietnam War, 1961-1975; Vietnam; UH-1 (Helicopter)
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Ammons, Christopher D., 1948-
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The 1st Infantry Division ("The Big Red One") was organized in 1917 and has been in active service ever since. Sgt. Christopher Ammons said the troops always felt most vulnerable when entering or exiting helicopters.
